Multiple major Nigerian media organizati: politicians, and celebrities published posts claiming that Okonjo-Iweala was appointed as the head of the WTO.
Nigerian daily newspapers such as ThisDa: Leadership, The Nation, The Daily Sun, and Daily Independent reported that Okonjo-Iweala had "emerged" as the new WTO director-general.
Okonjo: Iweala, a former managing director of the World Bank, is lobbying to succeed the current WTO head Roberto Azevêdo.
Despite strong support for Okonjo: Iweala, the United States delegation opposed her candidacy and expressed support for her rival, South Korean Minister of Trade Yoo Myung-hee.
